1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
an Elkoshite or native of Elkosh

2.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (or make) clean (literally or figuratively); by implication (in an adverse sense) to be bare, i.e. extirpated
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

4.brief: a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill
to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn
Bashan (often with the article), a region East of the Jordan
Karmel, the name of a hill and of a town in Palestine
a calyx (natural or artificial); generally, bloom
Lebanon, a mountain range in Palestine
to droop; by implication to be sick, to mourn

5.brief: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to undulate (as the earth, the sky, etc.; also a field of grain), particularly through fear; specifically, to spring (as a locust)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

6.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to flow forth (literally or figuratively); by implication, to liquify
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

7.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a fortified place; figuratively, a defence
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in

8.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a completion; adverb, completely; also destruction
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

9.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
near, with or among; often in general, to

a completion; adverb, completely; also destruction

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
to quaff to satiety, i.e. become tipsy
full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully

11.brief: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness

12.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to cut off; specifically to shear aflock or shave the hair; figuratively to destroy an enemy
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

13.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
a wavering, i.e. fall; by implication, a pole (as shaking); hence, a yoke (as essentially a bent pole)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, chastisement, i.e. (by implication) a halter; figuratively, restraint

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
properly, a pouring over, i.e. fusion of metal (especially a cast image); by implication, a libation, i.e. league; concretely a coverlet (as if poured out)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
